subject: Re: VA Java import
msgSnippet: The current process for junit.org is to ask me.  I want to get to some point where this isn t the case, but I haven t had the time to get there yet. In this
messageBody:
The current process for junit.org is to ask me. I want to get to
some point where this isn't the case, but I haven't had the time to
get there yet.

In this case I will link to wherever the latest stuff on VAJ
integration is. If silvermark would like to maintain VAJ integration
stuff I would be more than happy to link to it.

I also plan on writing up descriptions for all the stuff in files,
and linking to it, but time hasn't allowed. This is another chance
for someone to get linked to from junit.org.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org


--- In junit@y..., "Michael Silverstein" <msilverstein@s...> wrote:
> That seems reasonable. One thing - there's already a document on
> www.junit.org on using JUnit under VA Java. Given the availability
of a
> repository-based import for 3.7, this document should be updated to
point to
> the new download, as well as new instructions. Is there a process
for
> submitting changes to junit.org?
>
> Also, I noticed that many of the files in
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/ are not listed at
junit.org. It
> seems like they should be included. My concern is that things go
into
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/files/ but nobody notices them
unless
> they closely follow this forum or the download area, which doesn't
seem to
> be mentioned in junit.org.
>
> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> Mike Silverstein
> SilverMark, Inc.
> The object testing company
> http://www.silvermark.com
>

> > > move away
> > > > from that.
> > > > Import the source into VAJ in a new project called JUnit,
or
> > > > whatever suits
> > > > your fancy.
